<<<<<<< HEAD
A mirrour to confesse well for such persons as doe frequent this sacrament / abridged out of sundry confessionals, by a certaine deuout and religious man. Heigham, John, fl. 1639. Charles Borromeo, Saint, 1538-1584.
309 [i.e. 310], 1 p.
For Iohn Heigham, [St. Omer?] : Anno 1624.
This item contains five of the six parts mentioned in STC (2nd ed.) The Psalter of Jesus is lacking. Signatures: A¹², F-R¹². Errors in paging: p. 310 numbered 309; signatures A₃, and A₅ marked E₃ and E₅ respectively. Reproduction of original in: Harvard University. Library. A mirrour to confesse well -- Certaine very pious and godly considerations / by Iohn Heigham -- Divers devout considerations / by Iohn Heigham -- Certaine advertisements teaching men how to lead a Christian life / by S. Charles Boromeus -- A briefe and profitable execise of the seaven principall effusions of the pretious blood of our Lord Iesus Christ / translated ... by Iohn Heigham.
=======
